# elizaos/eliza Daily Update (Jan 5, 2026)
## OVERVIEW 
Today saw significant advancements in unifying client-side hooks with multi-transport support, alongside critical bug fixes for the SQL plugin and CI workflow enhancements.

## KEY TECHNICAL DEVELOPMENTS

### Unified Client Hooks and Multi-Transport Support
*   Introduced a new `useElizaChat` hook in the client package, unifying chat functionalities across HTTP, SSE, and WebSocket transports. This streamlines client-side interaction with the ElizaOS agent. ([#6300](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6300))
*   Aligned transport naming conventions between the `api-client` and `server` packages for consistency. ([#6300](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6300))

### SQL Plugin Stability and Reliability Improvements
*   Fixed an issue in the `plugin-sql` where PostgreSQL `SET LOCAL` commands failed due to incorrect parameterization, now using `sql.raw()` to prevent "syntax error at or near $1". ([#6316](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6316))
*   Addressed critical issues in `plugin-sql`, including adding pool configuration, an error handler, and fixing PGLite shutdown problems to prevent runtime crashes and connection issues. ([#6323](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6323))

### CI Workflow Enhancements and Claude Integration
*   Upgraded all Claude-powered CI workflows to use the stable v1 action and the Opus 4.5 model, improving AI-driven code reviews and security checks. ([#6324](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6324))
*   Added two new automated workflows for security and maintenance jobs to the CI pipeline. ([#6324](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6324))
*   Configured CI workflows to allow the Cursor bot to trigger Claude-related actions, enhancing automated code review processes. ([#6328](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6328))

## NEWLY OPENED PULL REQUESTS
*   [#6330](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6330) `test(plugin-sql): use withEntityContext in RLS tests + isolation in CI`: This PR aims to improve testing for the SQL plugin, specifically for Row-Level Security (RLS), by incorporating `withEntityContext` and ensuring isolation in CI.
*   [#6329](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6329) `feat(plugin-sql): add CachedDatabaseAdapter with LRU caching and servâ€¦`: This PR proposes adding a `CachedDatabaseAdapter` to the SQL plugin, featuring LRU caching, which is expected to enhance performance.

## CLOSED ISSUES

### Core Hooks and SDK-first Development
*   The core hooks implementation, including `useEliza` and `useElizaChat`, has been completed. ([#5928](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/5928))
*   The SDK-first hooks mode, allowing direct instantiation of Eliza in the browser via hooks, has been fully supported. ([#5966](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/5966))

### Messaging API Refinements
*   Issues related to double processing and transport alignment within the Messaging API have been resolved. ([#6298](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6298))

### Agent Lifecycle and Utilities
*   Lifecycle management hooks, such as `useAgentList`, `useStartAgent`, and `useStopAgent`, have been implemented. ([#5929](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/5929))

## NEW ISSUES

### Frontend Testing and Authentication
*   A new issue has been opened to provide a mock client for frontend testing, eliminating the need for a live server during development. ([#6326](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6326))
*   The need for JWT authentication and robust user management has been identified and opened as a new issue. ([#6327](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6327))

## ACTIVE ISSUES
No active issues with more than 3 comments.
